before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"frd1r","text":"Make sure that the thermocycler is programmed with the the annealing program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b295q","text":"While most biologically-synthesized DNA molecules are double-stranded, chemically-synthesized DNA molecules are single-stranded. In order to use them in a biological system, we need to make them double-stranded by \"sticking\" them to their complementary molecules:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqi7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bor6p","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"29q0c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fu88","text":"We \"stick\" them together by mixing them in equimolar amounts, then heating the mixture and cooling them slowly. As the image shows, the duplexed oligos are not a perfect match. Instead, they have four-base \"overhangs\" on each end -- this will be important in the next protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esg22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FDAEBA600D1E11ED811D57C7EC50A2A7","height":160,"id":274861,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"annealing.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inprbvh6p.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inppbvh6p.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inpqbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/inpnbvh6p.webp","width":550}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"57k1m","text":"Make sure you take care in your pipetting and mixing. The volumes are small!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"43tpg","text":"Nuclease-free TE buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9d31","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2b2ba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4re7l","text":"Guide and Guide RC oligonucleotides, dry or resuspended at a concentration of 100 uM.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chdti","text":"Two microcentrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6spi","text":"One thin-walled 200 ul PCR tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"audch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15qn9","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u85n","text":"Microfuge with a PCR tube rotor (optional)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b0i5","text":"Thermocycler programmed with a program for annealing oligos","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"420vu","text":"We resuspend and dilute oligonucleotides in TE, not water. The Tris keeps the pH at 8.0, which is good for stability, and the EDTA chelates ions and prevents nuclease degredation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vudm","text":"If the oligonucleotides have already been resuspended, skip to step 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ssg8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ir81","text":"Look carefully at the label of the oligo that you're resuspending. Find the line that looks like \"14.5 OD = 26.1 nmol = 0.46 mg\". (This is an example; the numbers on your tube will be different.) These are three different measurements of exactly how much DNA is in this tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jkc3","text":"Take the number of nmol and move the decimal point one place to the right. Add this number of microliters of TE to the blue-capped tube with the dried oligo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":51,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h7qj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5ua0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8esp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rt67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ida2","text":"For example, on the tube above, I take \"26.1 nmol\" and move the decimal to the right to get \"261\". Then I add 261 µl of TE to the tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eeu2o","text":"Vortex for 15 seconds to fully resuspend the oligo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f975f","text":"The resulting oligos are at a concentration of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"okhk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"1F30F4900D2011ED811D57C7EC50A2A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rfg0","text":"Using the TE and the microcentrifuge tubes, dilute the oligonucleotides to  . Make 100 µl of each. Record your dilution calculations in the table below. Ask an instructor or TA to double-check your math before proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2g8ic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s1t7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3755","text":" of resuspended oligo (100 µM concentration)","Volume of TE","Total volume","Final concentratinon"],["Guide oligo","","","100 µl","10 µM"],["Guide RC oligo","","","100 µl","10 µM"]],"guid":"4D8277200D1A11ED811D57C7EC50A2A7","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["","Volume of resuspended oligo (100 µM concentration)","Volume of TE","Total volume","Final concentratinon"],["Guide oligo","","","100 µl","10 µM"],["Guide RC oligo","","","100 µl","10 µM"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1op02","text":"If you are diluting previously resuspended oligos that have been frozen, make sure that the oligos are completely thawed before diluting them.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gis6","text":"In a thin-walled PCR tube, mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eent2","text":"  of oligo #1","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3o8kl","text":"  of oligo #2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eda9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aobjq","text":"Flick the tube several times to mix well, then use the microfuge to spin down the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3a3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b2od","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"3ACECF600D2011ED811D57C7EC50A2A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"3E05B7700D2011ED811D57C7EC50A2A7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"19tmc","text":"Label the tube and record how you labeled it in your lab notebook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7me79","text":"Find an instructor or TA to help you load the tube into the thermocycler and run the annealing program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Annealing Oligonucleotides
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s0r1","text":"TE is not hazardous; neither are synthetic DNA oligonucleotides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8oan","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kd83","text":"HOWEVER, we are shedding nucleases -- enzymes that degrade DNA -- all the time. Wear lab coats and gloves to keep your samples nuclease-free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
